briefdescription.para: Added attributes fields which are not committed.
New features which are not committed.
Changed attributes values which are not committed.
Changed geometries which are not committed.
Deleted attributes fields which are not committed. The list is kept sorted.
Deleted feature IDs which are not committed.

detaileddescription.para: Note a feature can be added and then deleted again before the change is committed - in that case the added feature would be removed from mAddedFeatures only and not entered here.

briefdescription.para: Renamed attributes which are not committed.
Add an attribute field (but does not commit it) returns true if the field was added.
Returns a list of added attributes fields which are not committed.
Returns a map of new features which are not committed.
Adds a feature.

simplesect.para: True in case of success and False in case of error

briefdescription.para: Insert a copy of the given features into the layer (but does not commit it)

memberdef.argsstring: (QgsFeatureId fid, int field, const QVariant &newValue, const QVariant &oldValue=QVariant())
memberdef.name: changeAttributeValue

briefdescription.para: Changed an attribute value (but does not commit it)
Changes values of attributes (but does not commit it).

simplesect.para: true if attributes are well updated, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Returns a map of features with changed attributes values which are not committed.
Returns a map of features with changed geometries which are not committed.
Change feature's geometry.
Attempts to commit any changes to disk.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the result of the attempt. If a commit fails, the in-memory changes are left alone.
This allows editing to continue if the commit failed on e.g. a disallowed value in a Postgres database - the user can re-edit and try again.

The commits occur in distinct stages, (add attributes, add features, change attribute values, change geometries, delete features, delete attributes) so if a stage fails, it's difficult to roll back cleanly. Therefore any error message also includes which stage failed so that the user has some chance of repairing the damage cleanly.

briefdescription.para: Delete an attribute field (but does not commit it)
Returns a list of deleted attributes fields which are not committed.

detaileddescription.para:
The list is kept sorted.

Deletes a set of features from the layer (but does not commit it)
Returns true if the specified attribute has been deleted but not committed.
Returns true if the specified feature ID has been added but not committed.
Returns true if the specified feature ID has had an attribute changed but not committed.
Returns true if the specified feature ID has been deleted but not committed.
Returns true if the specified feature ID has had its geometry changed but not committed.
Returns true if the provider has been modified since the last commit.
Renames an attribute field (but does not commit it)
Stop editing and discard the edits.
Emitted when an attribute has been renamed.
Signals emitted after committing changes.

parameterdescription.para: map of field index to new name

briefdescription.para: Emitted when a feature's geometry is changed.
This signal is emitted when modifications has been done on layer.
